summary: 1999 remains one of my favorite years of film.  Not only did some incredible films come out (Fight Club, American Beauty, Office Space), but this was the first year I started downloading movie trailers.  I remember downloading American Pie, End of Days, and The Blair Witch Project and watching them over and over in anticipation for their theatrical releases...
title: The Blair Witch Opening Night 1999

summary: A trip from the beginning to the present of the various online communities I've taken part in over 30 years
title: Online Communities of the Past and Present

summary: Not long ago, the ability to remotely track someone’s daily movements just by knowing their home address, employer, or place of worship was considered a powerful surveillance tool that should only be in the purview of nation states.  But a new lawsuit in a likely constitutional battle over a New Jersey privacy law shows that anyone can now access this capability, thanks to a proliferation of commercial services that hoover up the digital exhaust emitted by widely-used mobile apps and websites
title: The Global Surveillance Free-for-All in Mobile Ad Data
Designing a WebCard bitmap the hard way
